title: Roger Malvins Burial pacing in second paragraph

content.question: In the second paragraph (“Oh, who . . . centuries”), which of the following methods does the narrator use to shape the pace of the passage?

choices.label: Increasing the pace of the narrative by providing a glimpse into the characters’ future
Slowing the pace of the narrative to relate an episode from the boy’s past
Suspending the exposition of the narrative to expand on an idealized vision of pioneer life
Accelerating the unfolding of the narrative by revealing a key detail

content.answer: Suspending the exposition of the narrative to expand on an idealized vision of pioneer life

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Explain the function of a particular sequence of events in a plot.
